column4: I recently did an apt-get upgrade which must have included some xorg packages, and now X crashes randomly every few minutes (intel hardware) - how do I begin diagnosing such a problem?
how long ago the last update was ?
it was a large upgrade, probably a couple months worth of packages
did you try to boot safemode > netroot for dhcp, then dpkg-repair.. ?
I did not, how is dhcp involved?
is just to ge inet for the update
the two  thingys are choices from the safemode (no x involved) menu
just a second.. (thanks, by the way)
okay, dpkg repair is installing a whole mess of stuff... some of it xserver and intel related...
I give a candle, now cross fingers  ;-)
does the fact that dpkg repair is installing stuff mean that the upgrade did in fact fail in some way?
like, can i rule out the problem being caused by the new versions of software?
not in fact, but some packages are often held back with gdm active which seldom can cause this
